extendedIngredients.name: canned tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes with onions, undrained

extendedIngredients.name: pasta salad mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 package (6.4 ounces) Mexican-style rice and pasta mix

recipes.title: Mexican Rice with Chicken

winePairing.pairingText: Mexican on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. The J Vineyards & Winery Pinot Noir with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 48 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: J Vineyards & Winery Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: At J, we are devoted to the concept of terroir in the Russian River Valley, and our 2013 J Vineyards Pinot Noir is a reflection of this vintage, the vineyards and our attention to detail in the winery. Delivering bright berry flavors-red cherry, raspberry and blackberry- this elegant Pinot is enhanced by notes of licorice and red tea, which linger on the finish. Aromas of wild strawberries and spices delight the nose.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large skillet, cook and stir rice and pasta mix in butter until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add the water, tomatoes and contents of rice seasoning packet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook for 10 minutes.                                                                                            Add chicken and jalapeno. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.                                        Yield: 4 servings.                                                                                                     Editor's Note: This recipe was tested with Rice-a-Roni rice and pasta mix. When cutting hot peppers, disposable gloves are recommended. Avoid touching your face.                                                                            Editor's Note: Wear disposable gloves when cutting hot peppers; the oils can burn skin. Avoid touching your face.                                                                                                Originally published as Mexican Rice with Chicken in  Quick CookingSeptember/October 2004, p49                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 serving (1-1/2 cups) equals 385 calories, 12 g fat (5 g saturated fat), 79 mg cholesterol, 1,217 mg sodium, 42 g carbohydrate, 2 g fiber, 25 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large skillet, cook and stir rice and pasta mix in butter until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Add the water, tomatoes and contents of rice seasoning packet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Add chicken and jalapeno. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
